clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of a VAP Prevention Bundle in the PICU
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of a Bundle of Ventilator Associated Pneumonia (VAP) Prevention in the Pediatric Intensive Care Unit (PICU): an Observational Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

clinical_study.source: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS

brief_summary.textblock: This observational monocentric prospective study aims to evaluate the efficacy of new measures for ventilator associated pneumonia (VAP) management in the pediatric population in the pediatric intensive care unit (PICU) of Fondazione Policlinico Agostino Gemelli of 8 beds. The investigators will compare the incidence of VAP in the group of patients in which this protocol has been implemented to a retrospective control group of patients before the new protocol implementation. VAP bundle includes oral care hygiene measures (i.e chlorhexidine swab), to keep clean and dry ventilator circuits and head positioning at 45 degrees.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From 48 hours after intubation to 48 hours after extubation
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of VAP in pediatric patients intubated for more than 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of orotracheal bacterial colonization in ventilated patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 48 hours after intubation to 48 hours after extubation
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of orotracheal bacterial colonization in pediatric patients undergoing mechanical ventilation twice a week

arm_group.description: Patients admitted in our PICU before the implementation of the protocol for VAP prevention (from 01/01/2016 to 12/31/2017)
Patients admitted to our PICU since the VAP bundle has been introduced in the clinical practice (from 01/01/2018)

intervention.intervention_name: Measures for the VAP prevention in the PICU
intervention.description: Oral hygiene care (i.e chlorhexidine swab); clean and dry ventilator circuits; head positioning at 45 degrees.

intervention.intervention_name: Evaluation of VAP incidence before the protocol introduction
intervention.description: evaluation of VAP incidence in our pediatric population of intensive care patients before the implementation of the protocol for VAP prevention

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric patients admitted to our ICU requiring mechanical ventilation for more than 48 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age < 18 years
- patients receiving mechanical ventilation for more than 48 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- no informed consent
- pregnancy
- previous endotracheal antibiotic therapy
